original: Borgwall, Manne, redaktör, Kalmar, f. 7/12/84 i Borgholm av köpm. Victor Olsson o. Emma Petersson. — Kalmar h. a. 1. 95-96 o. 99-04, Kalmar hand:inst. 05, Barlockinst. i Sthlm 17. Res. t. Tyskl. 22 o. 24, Danm. 35. Kont. v. Kalmar Foder- o. Gödningsämnes A-B 06, adv:bitr. å A. Birodins Advibyrå 17-21, verksam i Kalmarpressen sed. 21, medarb. i Kalmar-Kalmar Läns Tidn. ’sed. 27. Red. f. Medlemsblad f. Kalmar nya fastigh:-äg:fören. sed. dess start 40. Hed:-led. av S :te Christophers gille i Kalmar 46, led. av Kalmar fornminnes-fören., Kalmar konstfören. o. Nya dryaden. Skr.: Från flydda tiders Kalmar (44). Hobbies: person- o. kulturhist., saml. av porträtt o. tidn:-urklipp, resor.
translated: Borgwall, Manne, editor, Kalmar, born on December 7th, 1884 in Borgholm to merchant Victor Olsson and Emma Petersson. He attended Kalmar high school in 1895-1896 and 1899-1904; Kalmar commercial institute in 1905; Barlock Institute in Stockholm in 1917. He traveled to Germany in 1922 and 1924, and to Denmark in 1935. He worked for Kalmar Foder and Gödningsämnes A-B in 1906, was a legal assistant at A. Birodins Advibyrå from 1917-1921, active in the Kalmar press since 1921, and a collaborator for Kalmar-Kalmar Läns Tidn. from 1927. He was the editor for the Member magazine for Kalmar's new property owners' association since its establishment in 1940. He was a member of St. Christopher's guild in Kalmar in 1946, and a member of Kalmar's antiquities society, art society, and Nya dryaden. He authored "From past times in Kalmar" in 1944. His hobbies included personal and cultural history, collecting portraits and newspaper clippings, and traveling.
